Have them discover: Ox (Octopus in reverse) 

Find a 5-step sentence that starts in parallel, goes to crossed, ends in parallel: Humans, Name, Animals, Name, Human (include any Converging and Chasing game pieces that you have so far) 

👆Will be called Gameboard: Tango Sentence

If you dance this sentence twice in a row, is it the same or different? Explain how/why? 

Discuss: What are the requirements for a gameboard that works?

lessons.title: First modifier
lessons.synopsis: First modifier
lessons.instructions:
Do: Orphan Fisherman Orphan Oz Orphan Orphan Orphan

Try with different Orphans, find smoothest sequence

What are modifiers? Like advancing, retreating, lateral

New modifier: Mini (m). Can be applied to White, to Black, or to both.  

Mini Oz (mOz) vs Oz

“Salida”: Orphan Fisherman Orphan mOz Orphan Orphan mOrphan

lessons.title: An intro to winged creatures
lessons.synopsis: An intro to winged creatures
lessons.instructions:
What about Ostrich? First winged creature. 

The Code: Winged creatures vs animals = Chasing. 

Find Ostrich Chasing clockwise, Chasing counterclockwise. 

Choose one and find two versions: White enters (leader’s sacada) or Black enters (follower’s sacada) 

Game board: Nonwinged Animal, Ostrich, Nonwinged Animal

Make your own gameboard

Fill your gameboard and dance it

lessons.title: Level 2 Ordeal
lessons.synopsis: Level 2 Ordeal
lessons.instructions:
Can they accurately and consistently distinguish between crossed system and parallel system? 

Can they explain the difference between crossed system and a crossed step? 

Can they accurately and consistently distinguish between Chasing and Converging? 

Can they explain the difference between Chasing and Converging? 

Can they show all the possible ways of Orbiting White around Black? 

Can they explain what modifiers are and how they are different from game pieces?

Can they demonstrate any move and apply the modifiers to it?

Can they make their own crossed system grid and fill it in correctly with the pieces they have? [Ox, Octopus, Ostrich, Ferret, Baboon]

Can they do any randomly generated 5-step sequence (that observes correct tango grammar) with the current game pieces? [Fool, Fisherman, Orphan, Boss, Bartender, Frank, Oscar, Benjamin, Ox, Oz, Octopus, Ostrich, Ferret, Baboon]  

Can they apply the Mini modifier to any randomly chosen game pieces — to White, Black, or both? 

Can they demonstrate Oz with both a White entry and a Black entry? 

Can they demonstrate Ostrich with both a White entry and a Black entry? 

Can they correctly decode a combination you present using these elements? 

Can they succeed in 5 4 3 2 1, playing White, with any piece so far?

Can they teach a randomly chosen lesson from this level in a way that is crystal clear? 

Did they make it their own? Can they explain exactly how they did that?

lessons.title: Walking patterns
lessons.synopsis: Walking patterns
lessons.instructions:
Try: Orphan mOscar Ferret Octopus Octopus Ferret mEve Orphan 
 
Make your own rad combinations

Tango Sentence: Human(s) + Proper name + Animal(s) + Proper name + Human

Now: when you do a Proper name, try doing 3 of them instead of 1.

lessons.title: Parallel magic three ways
lessons.synopsis: Parallel magic three ways
lessons.instructions:
Oz, Oz, Orphan (any). Try it also starting with miniOz 

Gameboard: Any human, Oz, Any human (3X2)

Do Oz three different ways: White entry, Black entry, Neither

Discover: Fairy 

Find Fairy the three ways. 

miniEve, Oz, Fairy, Eleanor

Make your own: Human, [Oz OR Fairy], Human, 3X2

lessons.title: More proper names
lessons.synopsis: More proper names
lessons.instructions:
Remember Orbiting. What if Black orbits White instead? 

The Code: Proper names, feminine. Eve, Eleanor. 

Again: One Name changes system! 

Do two Names and you’re back in original system

Try: Orphan Eve Eve Orphan

Try: Orphan Eleanor Eleanor Orphan

Try Orphan Eleanor Ella Oz

Make it a mOz and squash it small: “Milonguero turn” 

Tango Sentence now including feminine names

lessons.title: Finally we fly: 2 winged creatures
lessons.synopsis: Finally we fly: 2 winged creatures
lessons.instructions:
Discover: Bat. Hugward and Handward. 

Humans/Magical, Any Proper name, Bat. Try both White Bat and Black Bat. 

Now discover Flamingo, same way. 

Bat Flamingo Bat Flamingo.

Explore White and Black. 

Explore adding mini. 

Gameboard: Humans/Magical + Name + [Bat or Flamingo] + Name + Humans/Magical

lessons.title: Final two game pieces
lessons.synopsis: Final two game pieces
lessons.instructions:
Discover: Finch. 

Finch Finch Finch 

mEve Finch Ostrich Eleanor Ella Fairy Oz Eleanor Ella [Hugward] 

Discover: Butterfly (All the ways) 

Animal Butterfly Animal

lessons.title: Buddha and Oracle (Back Sacadas Yay!)

Human, Buddha, Human, 3X2

Gameboard: Humans/Magical + Name + Animal + Name + Humans/Magical

lessons.title: Putting it all together
lessons.synopsis: Putting it all together
lessons.instructions:
Ultimate game board: Any Human + Any Name + Any Animal + Any Name + Any Human (including ALL magical beings and winged creatures!!) 

Fine tune by adding minis, tuning with White vs Black sacadas, advancing/retreating/lateral, different shaped Orphans, adding more or less or different pivot for one or other or both

courses.title: Tango Learning Lab - Boise
courses.description:
Peer-to-peer curriculum for learning Argentine tango.

Organized by Tommy Smith

lessons.title: Connected Movement
lessons.synopsis: This exercise introduces the concept of lead/follow and how we move in a connected manner.
lessons.instructions:
One person makes movements, and the other copies them.

-Stand in front of each other without touching
-Movement options are weight changes and side/forward/back steps
-Switch roles
-Switch roles without speaking

Key concepts:
-Lead and follow: One person initiates the movement, the partner responds
-Frontality: Keeping your heart in front of your partner's heart
-Proximity: Maintaining the same distance to your partner throughout the movement
-Waiting: Moving slowly and not anticipating (follow)
-Intention: showing you are starting a movement before actually moving (lead)
graduationRequirements: Can lead the movements without leaving partner behind
Can follow movements while maintaining proximity
Can follow movements without getting ahead of the partner
